title: Get Started
text: get REDCap turned R database… can set REDCap token three ways! need help setting tokens see article –> placeholder
code: library(REDCapSync) projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects View(projects) # show your previously saved projects project <- setup_project(   short_name = "TEST_repeating",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.miami.edu/", # change to your institutions link   dir_path = getwd(), # or change to your intended file path   # force = T, # use this to force a refresh   merge_form_name = "patient",   use_csv = FALSE, # if you don't have Microsoft change to TRUE   auto_check_token = TRUE ) #1. set each time in your session (not recommended in saved/shared scripts!) Sys.setenv(REDCapSync_TEST = "YoUrNevErShaReToken") #2. set to your private R sessions! usethis::edit_r_environ() #finds your file # Then you add --> REDCapSync_TEST = 'YoUrNevErShaReToken' # then save file and restart R # If it worked you will see your token when you run... Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #And if your project object is setup properly... #3. Using the REDCap console project<-load_project("TEST") set_REDCap_token(project) # can see if it's set correctly view_REDCap_token(project)

title: Get Started
text: following functions represent core functions package.
code: project <- update_project(project) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object  project <- add_forms_transformation_to_project(project,forms_tranformation = default_forms_transformation(project)) project <- transform_project(project) # transform to most basic forms, can be modified project <- drop_redcap_dir(project) #run shiny app! run_REDCapSync() # dev functions not ready for public yet project <- clean_project(project) project <- summarize_project(project) #can use for subsets! project <- summarize_project(project) project %>% save_summary() # will save summary data, look at the tabs!

title: Get Started
code: project$metadata %>% add_list_to_global() project$data %>% add_list_to_global() #project$summary %>% add_list_to_global() #not ready for public listviewer::jsonedit(project) # view object

Sys.setenv(REDCapSync_TEST = "YoUrNevErShaReToken")  #2. set to your private R sessions! usethis::edit_r_environ() #finds your file # Then you add --> REDCapSync_TEST = 'YoUrNevErShaReToken' # then save file and restart R  # If it worked you will see your token when you run... Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #And if your project object is setup properly... #3. Using the REDCap console project<-load_project("TEST") set_REDCap_token(project) # can see if it's set correctly view_REDCap_token(project)

title: RosyREDCap Shiny App
text: following functions represent core functions package.
code: project <- update_project(project) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object   project <- add_forms_transformation_to_project(project,forms_tranformation = default_forms_transformation(project))  project <- transform_project(project) # transform to most basic forms, can be modified  project <- drop_redcap_dir(project)  #run shiny app! run_REDCapSync()  # dev functions not ready for public yet project <- clean_project(project) project <- summarize_project(project) #can use for subsets! project <- summarize_project(project) project %>% save_summary() # will save summary data, look at the tabs!

title: Tokens
text: REDCap API tokens equivalent username password. never shared anyone. Ideally, never directly written R script, especially plan sharing future. Never commit file containing token git GitHub forever history. ever doubt mind quickly regenerate token REDCap website. working real REDCap project ’s good practice regenerate token periodically, week, just safe. Precisely tokens sensitive, REDCapSync designed reference name token, “REDCapSync_TEST”. REDCapSync ever wants use token make API call REDCap, check Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST"). default token names start “REDCapSync_”, followed short_name chose setup_project().demonstrates set check tokens…

what: Setting Your Token for One Session
title: Tokens
text: can also set manually base R. Unless specifically set token Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") blank. Now token set R session . restarted R, blank .
code: library(REDCapSync) Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #>[1] "" # Assuming you already setup or loaded a project object you can set the token like this... project <- load_project("TEST") set_REDCap_token(project) # Set your token manually Sys.setenv(REDCapSync_TEST="a_FaKe_TOkEn") # again having this in a script is not advised but possible  # Get your token Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #>[1] "a_FaKe_TOkEn"

what: Setting Your Token for Any Session
title: Tokens
text: may find want reuse token, may several projects, convenient way store tokens separate location. One way personal .Renviron file. , check always confirm location file make sure ’s part cloud storage git GitHub. can use usethis::edit_r_environ() semi-permanently save token. time launch R session file run token visible specifically called Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST"). Open .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ() Add token like … REDCapSync_TEST = "faKeTokeN" Save file Close Restart R Session (Session tab .rs.restartR()). Confirm Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") reference token ever made saved REDCapSync name. example, REDCap project object token name project$token_name. future, may set token different way.
code: #Install usethis if you don't have it. #install.packages("usethis")  usethis::edit_r_environ() # Now save your token.... (without the comment symbol '#') # REDCapSync_TEST = "faKeTokeN" # Save the file and Close # Restart R Session (session tab) # .rs.restartR() # this will also restart R session for you. Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") # now should contain your token

title: REDCapSync
text: Several R packages exist using REDCap Application Program Interface (API) , REDCapR, redcapAPI, tidyREDCap. However, R package maintaining synchronized data pipelines REDCap. Enter REDCapSync, streamlines comprehensive extraction one multiples REDCap projects REDCapSync::sync().

title: REDCapSync
text: Using cache previous saves, file directory, REDCap log, {REDCapSync} updates data changed since last call. project becomes standardized nested R list object can used best R offer via statistics, visualization, shiny apps, ! REDCapSync unleashes full power REDCap API even basic R user. evolving aims REDCapSync … Wrap REDCap API functionality “behind--scenes” streamline use. Maintain local/cloud versions one many REDCap projects updating recently changed records user-defined schedule, daily, weekly, monthly. Automate standard tasks cleaning, deidentification quality control. Standardize creation custom data transformations subsets passed directory. Allow bulk imports uncoded data using R Excel/CSV. Power companion shiny app RosyREDCap leveraging combined strengths R REDCap, users can maintain strong data pipelines include statistics, visuals, even shiny applications!

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
code: add_project_field(   project,   field_name,   form_name,   field_type,   field_type_R = NA,   field_label = NA,   select_choices_or_calculations = NA,   field_note = NA,   identifier = "",   units = NA,   data_func = NA )

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project field_name Character. name field transformation applied. form_name Character. name form containing field. field_type Character. type field REDCap (e.g., "text", "checkbox", "dropdown"). field_type_R Character. corresponding R data type field. Default NA. field_label Character. label field. Default NA. select_choices_or_calculations Character. string specifying choices (dropdown, radio, checkbox fields) calculations (calculated fields). Default NA. field_note Character. optional note comment field. Default NA. identifier Character. string indicating whether field identifier (e.g., "Y" yes). Default empty string (""). units Character. units measurement field, applicable. Default NA. data_func Function NA. optional function transform validate data field. Default NA.

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_project_subset
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project subset_name Character. name subset create. filter_field Character. name field database filter . filter_choices Vector. values filter_field used define subset. dir_other Character. directory subset file saved. Default output folder within database directory. file_name Character. base name file subset saved. Default <project$short_name>_<subset_name>. form_names Character vector. Names forms include subset. Default NULL, includes forms. field_names Character vector. Names specific fields include subset. Default NULL, includes fields. deidentify Logical. Whether deidentify data subset. Default TRUE. reset Logical. TRUE, overwrite existing subset files name. Default FALSE.

code: drop_REDCap_to_directory(   project,   records,   smart = TRUE,   deidentify = FALSE,   include_metadata = TRUE,   include_other = TRUE,   with_links = TRUE,   forms,   merge_non_repeating = TRUE,   separate = FALSE,   str_trunc_length = 32000,   file_name,   dir_other )

title: Drop REDCap Data to Directory — drop_REDCap_to_directory
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project records Character vector records want dropped directory. smart Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, saves data new. Default TRUE. deidentify Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, deidentifies data. Default FALSE. include_metadata Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes metadata export. Default TRUE. include_other Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes data export. Default TRUE. with_links Optional logical (TRUE/FALSE) including links Excel sheets. Default FALSE. forms Optional character vector selecting specific forms export. merge_non_repeating Optional logical (TRUE/FALSE) merging non-repeating instruments. Default FALSE. separate Optional logical (TRUE/FALSE) separating form separate files opposed multi-tab Excel. Default FALSE. str_trunc_length Optional integer truncation strings. file_name Optional character string adding front file names. dir_other Optional character string different folder project$dir_path.

title: Drop REDCap Data to Directory — drop_REDCap_to_directory

title: Generate a Summary from a Subset Name — generate_summary_from_subset_name
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project subset_name Character. name subset generate summary. clean Logical. TRUE, data cleaned summarizing. Default TRUE. drop_blanks Logical. TRUE, records blank fields dropped. Default TRUE. include_metadata Logical. TRUE, metadata included summary. Default TRUE. annotate_metadata Logical. TRUE, metadata annotated summary. Default TRUE. include_record_summary Logical. TRUE, record summary included generated summary. Default TRUE. include_users Logical. TRUE, user-related information included summary. Default TRUE. include_log Logical. TRUE, log changes included summary. Default TRUE.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_REDCap_token

what: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: Setup Load project object pipeline.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
code: setup_project(   short_name,   dir_path,   redcap_base,   token_name = paste0("REDCapSync_", short_name),   reset = FALSE,   get_type = "identified",   labelled = TRUE,   metadata_only = FALSE,   sync_frequency = "daily",   batch_size_download = 2000,   batch_size_upload = 500,   entire_log = FALSE,   days_of_log = 10,   get_files = FALSE,   get_file_repository = FALSE,   original_file_names = FALSE,   merge_form_name = "merged",   use_csv = FALSE,   silent = FALSE )  load_project(short_name, validate = TRUE)  load_project_from_path(project_path, validate = TRUE)  load_test_project(short_name = "TEST_repeating", with_data = FALSE)

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: short_name character string spaces symbols representing unique short name REDCap project. dir_path Optional character string representing directory path want REDCap project data stored. missing, project object current R session. redcap_base character string representing base URL REDCap server. token_name optional character string setting token name. Default REDCapSync_<short_name> reset Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces setup even project object already exists. Default FALSE. get_type optional character REDCap API call type. data user ran sync_project. Default FALSE. labelled Logical (TRUE/FALSE). whether use labelled vs raw coded data output. metadata_only Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, updates metadata. Default FALSE. sync_frequency Frequency sync. Options "always", "hourly", 'daily', 'weekly', "monthly","never". check triggered calling function, can automated packages. Default daily batch_size_download Integer. Number records process batch. Default 2000. batch_size_upload Integer. Number records process batch. Default 500. entire_log Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves entire log. Default FALSE. days_of_log Integer. Number days checked log reset new project setup. Default 10. get_files Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves files REDCap. Default FALSE. get_file_repository Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves file repository REDCap. Default FALSE. original_file_names Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses original file names retrieved files. Default FALSE. merge_form_name character string representing name merged form. Default "merged". use_csv Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses CSV files data storage. Default FALSE. silent Logical (TRUE/FALSE). messages. validate Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, validates project object based current rules. Default TRUE. project_path character string representing file path exact <short_name>_REDCapSync.RData file loaded. with_data Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, loads test project object data included.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: REDCapSync project list object.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: function sets project object storing REDCap API token configurations required interacting REDCap server. ensures token valid ready use subsequent API calls. Neither function directly attempts communication REDCap. setup_project used first time initialize/link REDCap project. Mainly, sets unique short_name intended directory. Unless run reset = TRUE default first try load_project. dir_path technically optional without user save/load/update projects. load_project can used just short_name parameter already run setup_project past established directory. dir_path optional function can used relocated directory.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
code: if (FALSE) { # Initialize the project object with the REDCap API token and URL project <- setup_project(   short_name = "TEST",   dir_path = "path/to/secure/file/storage",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.yourinstitution.edu/" ) project <- load_project("TEST") }

code: summarize_project(   project,   with_links = TRUE,   deidentify = TRUE,   clean = TRUE,   drop_blanks = TRUE,   include_metadata = TRUE,   annotate_metadata = TRUE,   include_record_summary = TRUE,   include_users = TRUE,   include_log = TRUE,   separate = FALSE,   reset = FALSE )

title: Summarize REDCap Database — summarize_project
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project with_links Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes links summary. Default TRUE. deidentify Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, deidentifies summary data. Default TRUE. clean Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, cleans summary data. Default TRUE. drop_blanks Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, drops blank entries summary. Default TRUE. include_metadata Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes metadata summary. Default TRUE. annotate_metadata Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, annotates metadata summary. Default TRUE. include_record_summary Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes summary records summary. Default TRUE. include_users Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes user information summary. Default TRUE. include_log Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, includes logs summary. Default TRUE. separate Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, separates summary different sections. Default FALSE. reset Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces summary generation even issues. Default FALSE.

title: Summarize REDCap Database — summarize_project
text: List. Returns list containing summarized data, including records, metadata, users, logs, specified data.

title: Summarize REDCap Database — summarize_project
text: function filters REDCap database based provided parameters generates summary list. summary can include metadata, record summaries, user information, logs. function also supports deidentification cleaning data.

Default FALSE. silent Logical (TRUE/FALSE). messages. ask_about_overwrites Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, prompts user overwriting existing data. Default TRUE. save_to_dir Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, saves updated data directory. Default TRUE.
